  89  // checkModule() is called for each tab (once for each tab and once for each panel).

  90  
  91  function checkModule($moduleName) {
  92      global $module, $instrument_id_base, $row_rsRegistrants, 
  93          $lasnumber_1, $type, $mode, $codes;
  94      $tabQualifies = FALSE;
  95      $requirements = $module[$moduleName];    // look up the requirements for this report module

  96      // check if the instrument_id is valid

  97      if (strpos($requirements, $instrument_id_base) OR strpos($requirements, "ALL")) { 
  98          $tabQualifies = TRUE; 
  99      } else { 
 100          return FALSE; 
 101      }
 102      // check if the tab requires a manager status to show

 103      if (strpos($requirements, "MANAGER")) {
 104          if ($row_rsRegistrants['manlevelkey'] > 0) { $tabQualifies = TRUE; }
 105          else { return FALSE; }
 106      }
 107      if (strpos($requirements, "CHECKREPORT")) { 
 108          if ($mode == "checkreport") { $tabQualifies = TRUE; }
 109          else { return FALSE; }
 110      }
 111      // check if the tab requires a valid score

 112      if (strpos($requirements, "SCORE")) {
 113          if ($type <> "journal") { $tabQualifies = TRUE; }
 114          else { return FALSE; }
 115      }
 116      // check if the tab requires that the record have been coded

 117      if (strpos($requirements, "CODED")) {
 118          if ($codes['coded_1'] > 0) { $tabQualifies = TRUE; }
 119          else { return FALSE; }
 120      }
 121      
 122      if (strpos($requirements, "C_ARG")) {
 123          if ($codes['coded_arg_1'] > 0 OR $instrument_id_base == "SMJ") { $tabQualifies = TRUE; }
 124          else { return FALSE; }
 125      }
 126      return $tabQualifies;
 127  }

 424  // All argumentation-related data, based on code data

 425  // This query is built not to break if data aren't present, so there's no need to check for Argumentation compatibility before running it. 

 426  /* Argumentation_overall comments are selected out of the query by 1) argumentation quality mean, 2) the range of LAS score performance.  

 427  The query does a very weird thing: basically the >= operator doesn't seem to work; it acts like a > operator, so the search will return empty for certain lasnumbers. A possible workaround is to make the >= condition act on a slightly lower number, (lasnumber_1-.01). */
 428  
 429  $sql = sprintf("SELECT ao.quality AS overall_quality, 
 430      ao.implication AS overall_implication, 
 431      ao.argoverinfer AS overall_infer, av.vocabularycomment, 
 432      ae.coherenceenglishinfer AS english_infer, ae.implication AS english_implication
 433      FROM {$code_table} c 
 434      LEFT JOIN la_scores s ON c.lakey = s.lakey 
 435      LEFT JOIN la_argumentation_overall ao ON ROUND(c.argumentation_overall,0) = ao.arg_mean 
 436                      AND ROUND(s.lasnumber_1, 1) BETWEEN ao.las_number_low AND ao.las_number_high 
 437      LEFT JOIN la_argumentation_vocabulary av ON c.argumentation_vocabulary = av.vocabularykey
 438      LEFT JOIN la_argumentation_english_infer ae ON ROUND(c.argumentation_english,0) = ae.coherencekey
 439                      AND (1=1 OR s.lasnumber_1 BETWEEN ae.las_number_low AND ae.las_number_high) 
 440      WHERE c.lakey = %s {$sql_lacodeskey}", 
 441          SQLstr($lakey, "int"));
 442  $rsArgumentation = mysql_query($sql) or die(mysql_error());
 443  // echo $sql;

 584              "<p>".str_replace("[COUNT]", $numPotStrengths, $boilerplate['report_lsua_ps1'])."</p>".

 621          $tabtext_lsua_strengths = $text;

 819  // This function is used throughout the rubric instruments to stitch together stem feedback, in array form,

 820  // into coherent, syntactically smooth descriptions of your performance.

 821  function smoothNarrative ($comments = array()) {
 822      if (count($comments) == 0) { return ""; }
 823      
 824      $text = "";
 825      // String format: ^firstcomment|secondcomment|$

 826      $text .= "^";
 827      foreach ($comments as $c) { $text .= $c."|"; }
 828      $text .= "$";
 829      
 830      // stitch together the elements to flow naturally even if some codes are missing.

 831      // ensure no spaces after / before the helper characters

 832      $text = str_replace("^ ", "^", $text);
 833      $text = str_replace(array("| ", " |"), "|", $text);
 834      $text = str_replace("|$", "$", $text);
 835      // If the text starts with "and", replace the and.

 836      if (strpos(" ".$text, "^and")) {
 837          $text = str_replace("^and", "^In this performance, you", $text);
 838      }
 839      // If the text starts with "You also", then remove the word "also". 

 840      if (strpos(" ".$text, "^You also")) {
 841          $text = str_replace("You also", "You ", $text);
 842      }
 843      // Add commas before any "second-clauses", and remove the separation marker.

 844      $text = str_replace("|and", ", and", $text);
 845      $text = str_replace("|although", ", although", $text);
 846      // If there's a pipe that doesn't have a period before it, add a period.

 847      if (strpos($text, "|") AND !strpos($text, ".|")) {
 848          $text = str_replace("|", ".|", $text);
 849      } 
 850      // If the ending statement does NOT have a period, then add a period to it.

 851      if (!strpos($text, ".$") AND $text <> "^$") { 
 852          $text = str_replace("$", ".$", $text);
 853      }
 854      // remove the helper characters from the string.

 855      $text = str_replace(array("^", "$", "|"), " ", $text);
 856              
 857      return $text;
 858  }

 862  if (checkModule('llra_themes')) {
 863      /* This section prepares all of the text that will be dropped into the appropriate tabs later on.

 864      The text is all calculated here for 2 reasons: 

 865          1) I can recursively autogenerate the content for all tabs with the same bit of code

 866          2) the content needs to be prepared before the tab is created, because some tabs might be hidden */
 867      
 868      $llra_theme_titles = array("none", "cognition", "communication", "ethics", "emotion", 
 869                                                           "approach", "personality", "social skills");
 870      $llra_theme_labels = array("none", "cognition", "communication", "ethics", "emotion", 
 871                                                           "approach", "personality", "social");
 872      $llra_theme_tabtext = array("", "", "", "", "", "", "", "");
 873      // Slots for the STYLE (3rd-page) menus for each theme

 874      $llra_theme_codeslots = array(0, 456, 457, 453, 458, 455, 459, 460);
 875      
 876      // FOR each theme

 877      for ($cur_theme = 1; $cur_theme <= 7; $cur_theme ++) {
 878  
 879          // topher("Theme: ".$llra_theme_titles[$cur_theme]);

 880          // a query to find out what code numbers to look for, for this theme.

 881          // **** RELIES on having each theme stored in 3 consecutive code slots, as opposed to noncons.

 882          $row_rs_minmax = mysql_fetch_assoc(mysql_query("
 883              SELECT MIN(code_number) AS min, MAX(code_number) AS max FROM la_rubrics 
 884              WHERE instrument_id = 'LLRA' AND type = 'leadership themes' AND theme_name = ".
 885              SQLstr($llra_theme_labels[$cur_theme], "text") ));
 886          
 887          $min_code = $row_rs_minmax['min'];
 888          
 889          // Calculate the average score for this theme. 

 890          // Used both for the What's Next and for the recommendations below.

 891          $avg_score = 0;    $r_sum = 0; $r_count = 0;
 892          if (mysql_num_rows($rsTheseRubrics) > 0) { mysql_data_seek($rsTheseRubrics, 0); }
 893          while ($row_rsTheseRubrics = mysql_fetch_assoc($rsTheseRubrics)) {
 894              $r_sum += $row_rsTheseRubrics['las_number_low']; 
 895              $r_count ++;
 896          }
 897          if ($r_count > 0) { $avg_score = 1.0 * $r_sum / $r_count; }
 898          // Use the global score in case this theme wasn't coded.

 899          // (This means that all 7 themes tabs will always show up on the report.)

 900          if ($avg_score == 0) { $avg_score = $codes['code492']; }
 901          
 902          
 903          // Fetch FEEDBACK re: what you did (on a per-rubric basis)

 904          // Feedback is on a per-rubric basis; the query fetches all rubrics for the theme.

 905          // (There are up to 3 rubrics per LLRA theme.)

 906          $sql = sprintf(" SELECT r.rubric_stem AS stem_this, r.rubric_item AS item_this,
 907                  rnext.rubric_stem AS stem_next, rnext.rubric_item AS item_next
 908              FROM la_rubrics r
 909                  LEFT JOIN la_rubrics rnext ON r.instrument_id = rnext.instrument_id AND r.type = rnext.type
 910                      AND r.code_number = rnext.code_number AND r.las_number_low + 0.25 = rnext.las_number_low
 911              WHERE r.rubrickey = %s OR r.rubrickey = %s OR r.rubrickey = %s 
 912              ORDER BY r.code_number ", 
 913              SQLstr($codes['code'.zeropad($min_code, 3)], "int"),
 914              SQLstr($codes['code'.zeropad($min_code+1, 3)], "int"),
 915              SQLstr($codes['code'.zeropad($min_code+2, 3)], "int"));
 916          // topher("From code group ".'code'.zeropad($min_code, 3).": <br>".$sql); 

 917          $rsTheseRubrics = mysql_query($sql) or die(mysql_error);
 918          // topher($sql);

 919          
 920          // Now parse out the syntax for that feedback.

 921          if (mysql_num_rows($rsTheseRubrics) > 0) {
 922              $c_this = array();
 923              $c_next = array();
 924              // Text is dumped into arrays for "this" feedback and "next" feedback.

 925              // The arrays will be stitched together syntactically, later.

 926              while ($row = mysql_fetch_assoc($rsTheseRubrics)) {
 927                  if ($row['item_this'] == "") { continue; } // skip any blank codes

 928                  $c_this[] = $row['stem_this']." ".$row['item_this'];
 929                  $c_next[] = $row['stem_next']." ".$row['item_next'];
 930              }
 931              
 932              // print_r($c_this);

 933              // Stitch the text together nicely.

 934              $c_this = smoothNarrative($c_this);
 935              $c_next = smoothNarrative($c_next);
 936  
 937              // $c_this = implode($c_this);

 938              // $c_next = implode($c_next);

 939              
 940              // Add the text for this report tab, as well as the hidden content for the What's Next window

 941              if (str_replace(" ", "", $c_this) <> "") { 
 942                  $textToAdd = "<p>{$c_this}</p>";
 943                  
 944                  // Add the link and content for the What's Next feature

 945                  if (strlen($c_next) > 6) { 
 946                      /* 

 947                      // Prepare the correct phrases for the start of the 'this' and 'next' paragraphs

 948                      // (LLRA: The text for the current phase doesn't need to change.)

 949                      $c_next = preg_replace("/^\s?(<p>)?\s?In this performance, you/", 

 950                                                                   "$1At the next phase, learners", $c_next);

 951                      $c_next = str_replace("you", "learners", $c_next);

 952                      $c_next = str_replace("You", "Learners", $c_next);

 954                      
 955                      // Prepare the learning activity boilerplate

 956                      $activity = $boilerplate['report_indiv_whatsnext_activity'];
 957                      $activity = str_replace("[SCORE]", sprintf("%1.1f", $avg_score), $activity);
 958                      $activity = str_replace("[THEME]", $llra_theme_labels[$cur_theme], $activity);
 959                      // Add the text for the link and the content. By default, the link goes in a new paragraph.

 960                      $textToAdd .= "<p><a class='whats_next_link'>» what's next</a></p>";
 961                      $textToAdd = str_replace("</p><p><a", " <a", $textToAdd);
 962                      $textToAdd .= "<div class='whats_next_content'>
 963                              <h3>".ucfirst($llra_theme_labels[$cur_theme]).": what's next</h3>
 964                              <p>Test takers scoring at the next phase would see the following description:</p>".
 965                              // <p class='current'>{$c_this}</p>

 966                           "<p>{$c_next}</p>
 967                              {$activity}
 968                              <p>&nbsp;</p>
 969                          </div>";
 970                  }
 971                  
 972                  $llra_theme_tabtext[$cur_theme] .= $textToAdd; 
 973              }
 974          } 
 975          
 976          
 977          // Add the THINKING ABOUT LEADERSHIP feedback, if relevant to this current tab.

 978          if ($llra_theme_labels[$cur_theme] == "cognition") {
 979              // APPLICATION

 980              $row_rsCodeMenu = mysql_fetch_assoc(mysql_query(
 981                  "SELECT * FROM la_rubrics WHERE rubrickey = ".$codes['code451']));
 982              //$llra_theme_tabtext[$cur_theme] .= "<h3>".ucfirst($row_rsCodeMenu['menu_name'])."</h3>";

1025          }
1026          
1027          // strip special characters from this text

1028          $text = $llra_theme_tabtext[$cur_theme];

1260              $c_this = array();
1261              $c_next = array();
1262              // Text is dumped into arrays for "this" feedback and "next" feedback.

1263              // The arrays will be stitched together syntactically, later.

1264              while ($row = mysql_fetch_assoc($rsTheseRubrics)) {
1265                  if ($row['item_this'] == "") { continue; } // skip any blank codes

1266                  $c_this[] = $row['stem_this']." ".$row['item_this'];
1267                  if ($row['item_next'] <> "") { $c_next[] = $row['stem_next']." ".$row['item_next']; }
1268              }
1269              
1270              // Stitch the text together nicely.

1271              $c_this = implode($c_this);
1272              $c_next = implode($c_next);
1273              
1274              // Add the text for this report tab, as well as the hidden content for the What's Next window

1275              if (str_replace(" ", "", $c_this) <> "") { 
1276                  $textToAdd = "{$c_this}"; // For the LDPA, the stems contain the HTML markup and don't need <p> tags.

1277                  
1278                  // Add the link and content for the What's Next feature

1279                  if ($c_next <> "") { 
1280                    /* 

1281                      // Prepare the correct phrases for the start of the 'this' and 'next' paragraphs

1282                      $c_this = preg_replace("/^\s?(<p>)?\s?You/", "$1Currently, you", $c_this);

1283                      $c_next = preg_replace("/^\s?(<p>)?\s?You/", "$1At the next phase, learners", $c_next);

1284                      $c_next = str_replace("you", "learners", $c_next);

1285                      $c_next = str_replace("You", "Learners", $c_next);

1286                      */
1287                      // Prepare the learning activity boilerplate

1288                      $activity = $boilerplate['report_indiv_whatsnext_activity'];
1289                      $activity = str_replace("[SCORE]", sprintf("%1.1f", $avg_score), $activity);
1290                      $activity = str_replace("[THEME]", $ldpa_theme_labels[$cur_theme], $activity);
1291                      // Add the text for the link and the content. Some LDPA stems contain bulleted lists etc., 

1292                      // which complicates adding the ending link.

1293                      // By default, add the Whats Next text to a new paragraph following the stem.

1294                      $textToAdd .= "<p><a class='whats_next_link'>» what's next</a></p>";
1295                      // but combine it with the previous P if possible.

1296                      $textToAdd = str_replace("</p><p><a", " <a", $textToAdd); 
1297                      $textToAdd = str_replace("<p><a", " <a", $textToAdd); 
1298                      $textToAdd .= "<div class='whats_next_content'>
1299                              <h3>".ucfirst($ldpa_theme_labels[$cur_theme]).": what's next</h3>
1300                            <p>Test takers scoring at the next phase would see the following description:</p>".
1301                            // <p class='current'>{$c_this}</p>

1302                           "<p>{$c_next}</p>
1303                              {$activity}
1304                              <p>&nbsp;</p>
1305                          </div>";
1306                  }
1307                  
1308                  $ldpa_theme_tabtext[$cur_theme] .= $textToAdd; 
1309              }
1310          } 
1311          
1312          
1313          
1314          
1315          // Add comments on this theme from the 3rd coding page, if that code was marked.

1316          $theme_styleslot = $ldpa_theme_codeslots[$cur_theme];
1317          if ($codes['code'.$theme_styleslot] > 0) {
1318              $row_rsCodeMenu = mysql_fetch_assoc(mysql_query(
1319                  "SELECT * FROM la_rubrics WHERE rubrickey = ".$codes['code'.$theme_styleslot]));
1320              $ldpa_theme_tabtext[$cur_theme] .= $row_rsCodeMenu['rubric_item'];
1321          }
1322          
1323          // Fetch RECOMMENDATION ("Theme feedback") for each theme 

1324          // Lookup the recommendations text for this theme + this average score.

1325          $sql = sprintf("SELECT * FROM la_rubrics 
1326              WHERE instrument_id = %s AND type = %s 
1327              AND theme_name = %s AND %s BETWEEN las_number_low AND las_number_high ",
1328                  SQLstr($instrument_id_base, "text"),
1329                  SQLstr('theme feedback', "text"),
1330                  SQLstr($ldpa_theme_labels[$cur_theme], "text"),
1331                  SQLstr($avg_score, "double"));
1332          // echo "Query for recommendations: <br>".$sql; 

1333          $row = mysql_fetch_assoc(mysql_query($sql));
1334          // Add the recommendation for this theme

1335          if (isset($row['rubric_item']) AND $row['rubric_item'] <> "") {
1336              $ldpa_theme_tabtext[$cur_theme] .= $row['rubric_stem']." ".$row['rubric_item'];
1337          }
1338          
1339          // strip special characters from this text

1340          $text = $ldpa_theme_tabtext[$cur_theme];
1341          $text = preg_replace("/{[^{}]+}/", "", $text);
1342          // alt regex search: "/ *\([^)]*\) */"

1343          $text = str_replace(array("*"), "", $text);
1344          $ldpa_theme_tabtext[$cur_theme] = $text."<p>&nbsp;</p>";
1345          
1346      }

1657              LEFT JOIN la_survey_factor_categories c4 ON s.factor4 = c4.categorykey
1658              WHERE instrument_id = 'LERA' AND type = 'coding' AND part = 2 AND %s ",
1659                  $survey_groups_sql[$i]);

1669                  $s ++;

1672          // if some stems were selected in this grouping, prepare the comment.

1673          if ($s > 0) { 
1674              $text = $boilerplate[$survey_groups_boilerplate[$i]];
1675              $text = str_replace("[BULLETS]", "<ul>".$bullets."</ul>", $text);
1676              $text = str_replace("[COUNT]", $s, $text);

1693          c.argumentation_repetitive, c.argumentation_on_point, 
1694          c.argumentation_conciseness, c.argumentation_concise_overly, 
1695          c.argumentation_jargon, c.argumentation_framing, c.argumentation_clarity,
1696          c.argumentation_fragment, c.argumentation_persuasiveness, 
1697          c.argumentation_english, c.argumentation_overall, 
1698          c.argumentation_scale_mechanics, 
1699          c.code451 AS P_TAKEN_QUALITY, 
1700          c.code452 AS P_SOUGHT_QUALITY, 
1701          c.code453 AS P_COORD_SCORE,
1702          c.code454 AS CONTEXT_SCORE, 
1703          c.code455 AS DM_SCORE, 
1704          c.code456 AS COLLAB_SCORE, 
1705          c.code491,
1706          ((round(c.code492)-10)/(12.5-10)) AS LLRA_LEADTHEMES,
1707          ROUND(s.lasnumber_1, 2) AS lasnumber_1 
1708      FROM la_data d
1709          JOIN {$code_table} c ON d.lakey = c.lakey
1710          LEFT JOIN la_scores s ON d.lakey = s.lakey
1711          LEFT JOIN la_dilemmas di ON d.dilemmakey = di.dilemmakey
1712      WHERE d.userkey = %s AND (d.finalized %s OR d.lakey = %s) AND d.finalized <> 3
1713        {$filter_instrument_id} 
1714      GROUP BY d.lakey ORDER BY d.test_time, d.date_completed ", 
1715          SQLstr($row_rsRegistrants['userkey'], "int"),
1716          // if you're the test taker, include only other released records. Otherwise include finalized.

1717          ($row_rsRegistrants['userkey'] == $_SESSION['log_userkey'] ? " = 1" : " >= 1"),
1718          SQLstr($lakey, "int"));
1719  $rsLaDataOverTime = mysql_query($query_rsLaDataOverTime) or die("rsLaDataOverTime: ".mysql_error());
1720  $row_rsLaDataOverTime = mysql_fetch_assoc($rsLaDataOverTime);

1757  /**                     Queries for management level averages

1758  **** This only works with the old LDMAs. Once we have enough data, we'll want to make the sample levels table pull from both the old ldmascores and new la_scores. But when we do that, we'll also have to adjust the query to also look up the man level of each manlevelkey, since those are not aligned in the new data. Just an extra step to remember. 

1759  */
1760  
1761  $query_rsManLevelAverages = "SELECT AVG(ldmascores.lasnumber_1) AS avg, ldma.manlevel, count(ldma.ldmakey) AS n 
1762  FROM ldma, ldmascores 
1763  WHERE ldma.ldmakey = ldmascores.ldmakey AND ldmascores.lasnumber_1 > 8 
1764  GROUP BY ldma.manlevel ORDER BY ldma.manlevel DESC";
1765  $rsManLevelAverages = mysql_query($query_rsManLevelAverages, $Assessment) or die(mysql_error());
1766  $row_rsManLevelAverages = mysql_fetch_assoc($rsManLevelAverages);
1767  
1768  // Store the average score for each manlevelavg

1769  $manLevelAvg = array();
1770  $manLevelN = array();
1771  while ($row_rsManLevelAverages = mysql_fetch_assoc($rsManLevelAverages)) {
1772      $manLevelAvg[$row_rsManLevelAverages['manlevel']] = round($row_rsManLevelAverages['avg'], 1);
1773      $manLevelN[$row_rsManLevelAverages['manlevel']] = $row_rsManLevelAverages['n'];
1774      // We're not currently displaying Ns, but when we do it will be easy to do.

1775  }

1781  // ------------------------- CHART QUERIES ------------------------- //

1782  
1783  $rand = "(RAND()*4)-2";
1784  $query_chartResultsByTestTime = sprintf("SELECT d.test_time AS TEST_TIME, 
1785          ROUND(s.lasnumber_1, 2) AS LAS_SCORE,
1786          LEAST(c.argumentation_overall * 20, 100) AS argumentation_overall,
1787          LEAST(c.argumentation_scale_mechanics * 20, 100) AS argumentation_scale_mechanics,
1788          
1789          LEAST(ROUND((c.argumentation_persuasiveness*20)+{$rand}), 100) AS arg_persuasiveness, 
1790          LEAST(ROUND((c.argumentation_probe*20)+{$rand}), 100) AS arg_probe, 
1791          LEAST(ROUND((c.argumentation_clarity*20)+{$rand}), 100) AS arg_clarity,
1792          LEAST(ROUND((c.argumentation_fragment*20)+{$rand}), 100) AS arg_fragment, 
1793          LEAST(ROUND((c.argumentation_framing*20)+{$rand}), 100) AS arg_framing, 
1794          LEAST(ROUND((c.argumentation_relevance_scenario*20)+{$rand}), 100) AS arg_relevance_scenario, 
1795          LEAST(ROUND((c.argumentation_repetitive*20)+{$rand}), 100) AS arg_repetitive, 
1796          LEAST(ROUND((c.argumentation_on_point*20)+{$rand}), 100) AS arg_on_point, 
1797          LEAST(ROUND(IF(c.argumentation_conciseness > 0, 
1798               c.argumentation_conciseness*20, c.argumentation_concise_overly*20)+{$rand}), 100) AS arg_conciseness, 
1799          LEAST(ROUND((c.argumentation_jargon*20)+{$rand}), 100) AS arg_jargon, 
1800          LEAST(ROUND((c.argumentation_spelling*20)+{$rand}), 100) AS arg_spelling,
1801          LEAST(ROUND((c.argumentation_capitalization*20)+{$rand}), 100) AS arg_capitalization,
1802          LEAST(ROUND((c.argumentation_punctuation*20)+{$rand}), 100) AS arg_punctuation,
1803          LEAST(ROUND((c.argumentation_other_grammar*20)+{$rand}), 100) AS arg_other_grammar,
1804          
1805          LEAST(ROUND(c.code451), 100) AS P_TAKEN_QUALITY, 
1806          LEAST(ROUND(c.code452), 100) AS P_SOUGHT_QUALITY, 
1807          ROUND(c.code453, 1) AS P_COORD_SCORE,
1808          ROUND(c.code454, 1) AS CONTEXT_SCORE, 
1809          ROUND(c.code455, 1) AS DM_SCORE, 
1810          ROUND(c.code456, 1) AS COLLAB_SCORE,
1811  
1812          /* These are only temporarily present in the all-instruments version of this query.

1813          What a resource hogging mess this page is. */
1814          comp_ptaken.average AS COMPARISON_PTAKEN,
1815          comp_psought.average AS COMPARISON_PSOUGHT,
1816          comp_pcoord.average AS COMPARISON_PCOORD,
1817          comp_context.average AS COMPARISON_CONTEXT,
1818          comp_dmprocess.average AS COMPARISON_DMPROCESS,
1819          comp_collab.average AS COMPARISON_COLLAB,
1820  
1821          ROUND(c.code491,2) AS LLRA_LEADQUAL,
1822          ROUND(c.code492,2) AS LLRA_LEADTHEMES,
1823          ROUND(c.code491,2) AS LRJA_THEMES,
1824          ROUND(c.code491,2) AS LDPA_THEMES,
1825          ROUND(c.code493,2) AS LIMA_THEMES,
1826          ROUND(c.code491,2) AS LERA_THEMES,
1827          ROUND(c.code491,2) AS SMA_THEMES,
1828          ROUND(sd.result_avg_page1,1) AS SMS_SCORE,
1829          ROUND(c.code481,1) AS SMJ_SCORE_STUDENT,
1830          ROUND(c.code482,1) AS SMJ_SCORE_TEACHER_ALL,
1831          ROUND(c.code483,1) AS SMJ_SCORE_TEACHER_TONLY
1832      FROM la_data d
1833          LEFT JOIN {$code_table} c ON d.lakey = c.lakey
1834          LEFT JOIN la_scores s ON d.lakey = s.lakey
1835          LEFT JOIN la_dilemmas di ON d.dilemmakey = di.dilemmakey
1836          LEFT JOIN la_survey_data sd ON d.lakey = sd.lakey
1837          LEFT JOIN demogs_man_level dm ON d.manlevelkey = dm.manlevelkey
1838          LEFT JOIN demogs_man_level_general dmg ON dm.man_level_number = dmg.man_level_number
1839  
1840          /* Joins to fetch a simple comparison value, the average for your management level.

1841          Messy I know. */
1842          LEFT JOIN man_levels_theme_averages comp_ptaken ON 
1843              dmg.manlevelgeneralkey = comp_ptaken.manlevelgeneralkey 
1844              AND d.instrument_id IN ('LDMA', 'LDMA_JOURNAL') 
1845              # AND d.test_time = comp_ptaken.test_time 

1846              AND comp_ptaken.theme_name = 'perspective_taking'
1847          LEFT JOIN man_levels_theme_averages comp_psought ON 
1848              dmg.manlevelgeneralkey = comp_psought.manlevelgeneralkey 
1849              AND d.instrument_id IN ('LDMA', 'LDMA_JOURNAL') 
1850              # AND d.test_time = comp_psought.test_time 

1851              AND comp_psought.theme_name = 'perspective_seeking'
1852          LEFT JOIN man_levels_theme_averages comp_pcoord ON 
1853              dmg.manlevelgeneralkey = comp_pcoord.manlevelgeneralkey 
1854              AND d.instrument_id IN ('LDMA', 'LDMA_JOURNAL') 
1855              # AND d.test_time = comp_pcoord.test_time 

1856              AND comp_pcoord.theme_name = 'perspective_coordination'
1857          LEFT JOIN man_levels_theme_averages comp_context ON 
1858              dmg.manlevelgeneralkey = comp_context.manlevelgeneralkey 
1859              AND d.instrument_id IN ('LDMA', 'LDMA_JOURNAL') 
1860              # AND d.test_time = comp_context.test_time 

1861              AND comp_context.theme_name = 'contextual_thinking'
1862          LEFT JOIN man_levels_theme_averages comp_dmprocess ON 
1863              dmg.manlevelgeneralkey = comp_dmprocess.manlevelgeneralkey 
1864              AND d.instrument_id IN ('LDMA', 'LDMA_JOURNAL') 
1865              # AND d.test_time = comp_dmprocess.test_time 

1866              AND comp_dmprocess.theme_name = 'decision_making_process'
1867          LEFT JOIN man_levels_theme_averages comp_collab ON 
1868              dmg.manlevelgeneralkey = comp_collab.manlevelgeneralkey 
1869              AND d.instrument_id IN ('LDMA', 'LDMA_JOURNAL') 
1870              # AND d.test_time = comp_collab.test_time 

1871              AND comp_collab.theme_name = 'collaborative_capacity'
1872  
1873      WHERE (d.finalized %s OR d.lakey=%s) AND d.finalized <> 3 AND d.userkey=%s 
1874          {$filter_instrument_id} 
1875      GROUP BY d.lakey 
1876      ORDER BY d.test_time", 
1877          // if you're the test taker, include only other released records. Otherwise include finalized.

1878          ($row_rsRegistrants['userkey'] == $_SESSION['log_userkey'] ? " = 1" : " >= 1"),
1879           SQLstr($lakey, 'int'),
1880          SQLstr($row_rsRegistrants['userkey'], 'int'));
1881  // topher($query_chartResultsByTestTime); topher();

1882  $rsChartResultsByTestTime = mysql_query($query_chartResultsByTestTime) or die(mysql_error());
1883  $totalRows_rsChartResultsByTestTime = mysql_num_rows($rsChartResultsByTestTime);
1884  
1885  
1886  
1887  $query_chartLectByManLevel = sprintf("SELECT mlg.man_level_general_name AS MAN_LEVEL, 
1888      COUNT(d.lakey) AS N, 
1889      ROUND( AVG( s.lasnumber_1 ), 2) AS LASNUMBER 
1890      FROM la_data d 
1891      JOIN la_scores s ON d.lakey = s.lakey
1892      JOIN registrants r ON d.userkey = r.userkey
1893      JOIN demogs_man_level_general mlg ON d.manlevel_gen_adjusted = mlg.manlevelgeneralkey 
1894      WHERE d.finalized >= 1 
1895      GROUP BY mlg.man_level_number ORDER BY mlg.man_level_number", 
1896              SQLstr($userkey, "int"));
1897  $rsChartLectByManLevel = mysql_query($query_chartLectByManLevel, $Assessment) or die("rsChartLectByManLevel: ".mysql_error());
1898  
1899  $query_rsChartOldLect = sprintf("SELECT man_level AS MAN_LEVEL, n AS N, lasnumber AS LASNUMBER 
1900      FROM la_ldma_olddata ORDER BY man_level_number ", 
1901          SQLstr($userkey, "int"));
1902  $rsChartOldLect = mysql_query($query_rsChartOldLect, $Assessment) or 
1903      die("rsChartOldLect: ".mysql_error());
